node.name: The Telgar Inn, Game Room
node.description: The walls in this room are adorned with stuffed and mounted bear heads, birds, fish and other game. All are amazing specimens, most overly large for their species, obviously a great feat for the hunter or trapper responsible for their demise. Several small gaming tables are scattered throughout the room. A quiet game of cards is played unendingly by some of the towns elders.

node.name: The Telgar Inn, Upstairs Hallway
node.description: At the top of the stairs is the entrance to a large dormitory. Down the hallway is a door to a more private room. The hallway is unfurnished except for a lantern hanging from the ceiling and a ladder leading up to a loft area. The wood floor is old and worn, warped and sagging from years of feet passing back and forth.

node.name: The Telgar Inn, The Loft
node.description: A tiny loft space is tucked up under the rafters of the peaked roof of the Inn. A braided rug covers the rough board floor offering the only place to sit besides a trundle bed tucked to one side. The room is usually the quarters of the tavern owner and his wife, but is occasionally used for guests when the Inn is very full so there is an absence of personal belongings.

node.name: The Telgar Inn, Private Suite
node.description: This is the best suite the Inn has to offer and is reserved for the town's most important guests or those with the most money. A large window, which overlooks the great Langenfirth Tree, brightens the room with sunlight. A large bed with a down mattress fills a good part of the room. A small writing table with a comfortable chair has been placed near the window.

This is the best suite the Inn has to offer and is reserved for the town's most important guests or those with the most money. A large window, one of the few in the town with glass panes, is closed against the night's chill. A large canopied bed with a down mattress fills a good part of the room. A long white candle in a bronze candlestick flickers on a small writing table near the window.

node.name: The Telgar Inn, The Dormitory
node.description: Most of the second floor is taken up by a huge communal dormitory for traders and trappers passing through the town. Sunlight streams through a small window at one end of the room. Large bunks run along the other walls of the room, comfortably spread with clean sheets and warm, although well-used, wool blankets.

Most of the second floor is taken up by this huge communal dormitory for traders and trappers passing through the town. The soft glow of a lantern lights the room enough so late arrivals do not stub a toe, but it is not bright enough to bother the sleepers. Large bunks run along the other walls of the room, many of which are already occupied by tired travellers.

node.name: Langenfirth, Kamze's Repairs
node.description: Several windows in the cabin's walls allow the breeze to enter and fill the room with the scent of the forest. Kamze stands behind a tall wooden counter littered with leather armor in various stages of repair. An ebonwood longbow hangs on the wall beside a sign made from a tanned Inkhorne pelt.

node.name: Ranger Guild, Courtyard
node.description: A neatly kept yard covered with wispy grass surrounds a large log building with a high-peaked, green roof. A wooden door swings back and forth on a creaky hinge in the front of the cabin. The courtyard opens up to spacious yards on both sides. From the distance the twanging of bow strings and the thunk of arrows hitting their mark can be heard.

node.name: Ranger's Guild, Practice Yard
node.description: Along the far side of the yard are split logs propped upright with targets drawn on them. Many arrows are imbedded in the wood, although some have missed their mark and lay scattered about the yard. Several bowman stand about testing the pull of their bows and examine the arrows stacked in their quivers.

Utter darkness under the trees prevents identification of the source of sounds in the underbrush by sight. The occasional whisper of a branch brushing against something could be anything from the passing of a large animal, a person or simply a stray breeze.

node.name: The Rangers' Guild, Practice Yard
node.description: The area here has been set aside for the practice of woodland and survival skills. Several pits have been dug to be used for building and lighting fires and to use as cooking sites. A half finished lean-to stands near a corner of the yard, and a pile of wood, much of which is partly carved into what eventually will be useful items, sits in another.

Utter darkness under the trees prevents identification of the source of sounds in the underbrush by sight. The occasional whisper of a branch brushing against something could be anything from the passing of a large animal, a person or simply a stray breeze.

node.name: The Fur Exchange, Trading Office
node.description: The Exchange is one of the busiest places in Langenfirth. Hunters and trappers arrive constantly with new piles of hides and pelts from the northern hills. Traders regularly arrive delivering goods from the south or looking for some select furs to buy on speculation.

node.name: Abotenik's Pawnshop, Frontroom
node.description: An amazing assortment of goods is strewn about the shop. Items covered with dust as old as the glaciers, are tucked in every nook and cranny and nearly-new items from Riverhaven and Crossing shops fill one wall. Used and outdated fishing and trapping gear are stacked in piles everywhere. Bynari Abotenik, the eldest son, is spreading the piles to air out the more pungent odors. He works his way back to the stone counter glancing at you occasionally to see if you have your wares ready.

node.name: Smells Like a Rat
node.description: Mangy pelts of all shapes, sizes and scents cover the floor, though exactly which animal is represented by what pile of fur is anyone's guess. It's all the same to the shop owner, since his price never varies no matter what rag a foolhardy soul deigns to carry away.

node.name: Furs and Furnishings, Sales Room
node.description: The scrubbed pine walls and floor of D'ianrey Peral's tiny cabin are cluttered with animal skins and simple wooden furnishings, each item perfectly preserved and as rich in color as the day it was culled. D'ianrey's tanned Elven features glow with quiet pride as she allows customers to browse amongst her inventory of rustic crafts, each bed and hammock and rug from her hand imbued with the spirit of the wilds which she embodies.

node.name: Hayseed and Hatchet
node.description: Piles of fragrant pine sticks and sweet-smelling hay lend a pleasant, woodsy fragrance to this tiny shop. An underlying aroma of damp earth wafts around the room, drifting off a pile of crudely-shaped mud and straw bricks stacked against the back wall. Xlaie, a stoop-shouldered Human woman of indeterminate age, leans casually against a splintered pine counter in the center of the room.

node.name: Hayseed and Hatchet, Door Stack
node.description: Stacks of doors lie haphazardly on top of each other, cluttering the narrow entrance to this ragged lean-to. Leaning against the weathered plank walls, more doors threaten to topple like dominoes if disturbed by an inquisitive hand or a brief gust of breeze from the open back of the building. Work benches and tools crowd the dirt floor, and a faint smell of damp wood fills the air.

node.name: Net and Bait, Fish Market
node.description: The market reeks of fish although it sells a variety of goods. Once nothing more than a shop for bait, it now buys the local catch and sells many sundries along with the fish to travelers and locals alike. A large barrel marked Today's Special sits in a corner near the door. Shelves of sundries line the wall and there is a selection of tackle along another. The sound of fish being slapped hard on wood, and the rending sound of a knife through scales is heard from the back.

node.name: Brother Yorgi, Herbalist
node.description: An ancient empath putters about the shop, tending small pots of herbs. He seems to mutter constantly, either to himself or to his plants. His goods are stored on shelves in various clay jars and, since none are labeled, it is hoped that the good Yorgi knows what is in them.

node.name: Calliana Leather Goods, Salesroom
node.description: The smell of freshly tanned leather is overwhelming. Leather clothing, footwear and armors of many designs hang about the walls. Calliana is young for an elf but spent many years as a Ranger until the loss of one eye forced her to retire to safer pastimes. Her leatherworking skill is unsurpassed whether it is a new item or just the patching of an old piece.

node.name: Shalan's Peltry, Showroom
node.description: From the most casual of sportsman to the life-long hunt enthusiast, Shalan's Peltry offers a cozy, friendly place at which to conduct business after the hunt is over. A jovial, well-respected native of Langenfirth, Mato Shalan is known for his fair appraisals and honest opinions. Business is conducted informally around a circular table that dominates the center of the room. A smaller table with several comfortable chairs provides a nice environment for casual discussion.

node.name: Shalan's Peltry, Tannery
node.description: Crates of tanning supplies are stacked in tall columns against the walls of this small back room. A sharp, acrid smell can be detected despite the overlying sweetness of the scented candles burning about the room. Among the crates stands a small oak table strewn with various tools and bits of leather. A sturdy wooden plank serves as a counter for those wishing to make purchases.

node.name: Therenborough, Chanters' Retreat
node.description: Whimsical wind chimes dangle from trees and find similar perches on signposts and shrubs. In spite of their overwhelming numbers, the chorus they produce is exceedingly soothing. Along either side of a granite-strewn walkway are tufts of ornamental flowers, all low to the ground and caressing variegated sage.

node.name: Therenborough, Chanters' Retreat
node.description: A simple white-washed picket fence marks the boundary of the walkway as it traces its route along the edge of an L-shaped yard. A dainty swing that would seat two or three small children sits forlornly on the grass, and oddly enough is surrounded by a vast assortment of pinwheels. There are solitary pinwheels in pots, bouquets of pinwheels in great glass jars, and in between each slat of the picket fence is a double row of them -- one short, one tall.

node.name: Therenborough, Chanters' Retreat
node.description: Three shiny metal globes sit evenly spaced at the border of a yard of multi-colored grass. Pastel ribbons criss-cross with seeming abandon over the more naturally occuring shades of green, each cut at a different height to add texture to the landscape. Here and there in the chaotic mix is a cream-shaded ceramic pot displaying an odd arrangement of dried twigs, on which one finds an assortment of shells, beads, and arrow flights.

node.name: Therenborough, Chanters' Retreat
node.description: Sweet honeysuckle hedges border a grassy expanse punctuated by a large banyan. The suspended roots of this ancient tree grow down to the ground at intervals to create natural nooks, where artisans have been known to gather for festivals or other neighborhood celebrations.

node.name: Therenborough, Chanters' Retreat
node.description: A large ditch filled with painted rocks runs along a bizarre pink lawn that leads to a handful of houses. A layer of tin has been poured upon the sides of the ditch, so that they catch the light of the sun and reflect it back in a sparkling wash of silver.

A large ditch filled with painted rocks runs along a bizarre pink lawn that leads to a handful of homes. A layer of tin has been poured upon the sides of the ditch, so that they catch the scant light in the vicinity and reflect it back in a subtle glow of silver.

node.name: Therenborough, Chanters' Retreat
node.description: Rainbow-hued foil hangs in an array of shapes that twist and twirl on a dead oak. Every kiss of a breeze sets the entire collection to dancing in a surprisingly organized fashion. There is a carving at the base of the tree, probably decades old, done in an Elothean artistic style.

node.name: Therenborough, Chanters' Retreat
node.description: A large glass bowl filled with tiny jeweltone marbles sits upon a weathered table on an overgrown lawn. Two candlesticks, clotted with layers of wax, lie haphazardly at its side. The oddity of the scene becomes apparent only when you realize you are looking at a painting on the side of a stone wall -- the image is so perfect in perspective and detail, you could swear the weeds are bending in the wind.

node.name: Therenborough, Chanters' Retreat
node.description: A snaking hedge of jasmine separates this quiet cul-de-sac from the rest of the neighborhood. Several lifesculpted chairs surround a similarly crafted round table just beyond the hedge, right next to a wooden, hand-made set that looks rather shabby by comparison. Two relatively young junipers stretch above the jasmine, reaching for the sky.

node.name: Therenborough, Chanters' Retreat
node.description: The rich soil underfoot gives up its heady aroma as one moves among the sturdy roots of this ancient banyan. Though innumerable branches overhead are heavy with foliage, the roots themselves, which form several small alcoves, are ruddy and featureless. Thoughtful residents have placed stone benches in a semi-circle about this side of the tree.

node.name: Northern Pride, Main Deck
node.description: This is the only barge of its type to ply the waters of Lake Gwenalion. Ambitiously designed with an upper deck for passengers, its aft is completely given over to cargo. Built recently, everything about it smacks of economy and minimalism.

node.name: El'Bain's Stop, Picnic Area
node.description: The quiet surroundings of this picnic area give weary travelers a short break before moving on.
A singing bird, lost in the limbs of a nearby tree, pays respect to the tranquility of this rest area. Somehow the simplistic chirping soothes tight muscles and suppresses life's worries.

node.name: Bowyer Shop, Showroom
node.description: The Bowyer, Jarrod, can supply the eager hunter with just about any finely crafted ranged weapon desired. On display along the walls of the shop are fine bows and well-balanced arrows. Jarrod is a wiry elf who has lived most his life in the northern hills. His skill at his craft tends to make his items more expensive, but he is willing to dicker and loves a fair trade, as can be seen by the satisfied customers leaving happily with a purchase, and return buyers eagerly lining up to make a new selection.

node.name: Delkai's Store
node.description: The thin, wooden slats which comprise the floor of this little store creak under the weight of customers who wander about, inspecting the goods. Sitting near the back wall is Delkai Vendbit, who scribes endlessly in a leather-bound journal when he isn't busy helping patrons.

node.name: The Beech Cordon, Inner Circle
node.description: Two ironwood trees frame the entrance to a circle of fourteen evenly-spaced towering beech trees. The branches arch high overhead and entangle to form a natural canopy that shelters the area from harsh weather. A fire burns at the center of the grove, the source of the tempting aroma of roasted meats and vegetables.

Two ironwood trees frame the entrance to a circle of towering silhouetted beech trees. The branches arch high overhead and entangle to form a natural canopy. On clear nights, the stars peek through the leafy boughs like gems woven in a goddess' tresses. A fire burns low in the center of the grove, the source of inviting aromas of roasted meats and vegetables.

node.name: Beech Glade, Sleeping Bower
node.description: Sheltering branches surround a small glade and shield this area from the forest to the north. Weary travelers may rest in one of the many hammocks strung through the trees. A large chest stores blankets for those who prefer to sleep on the ground. The rustle of the branches and the song of distant larks lure sweet dreams to the drowsy.

Sheltering branches surround a small glade and shield this area from the forest to the north. Weary travelers may rest in one of the many hammocks strung through the trees. A large chest stores blankets for those who prefer to sleep on the ground. Fireflies wink from their homes in the forest floor to dance in a warding ring of light around the trees, while the sounds of rustling branches and lullaby of a nightingale float soothingly through the dense woods.

node.name: Beech Glade, Butternut Tree
node.description: A huge spreading butternut tree stands just outside the circle of trees. A large hole with earthen stairs leads to a space amongst its roots. A nearby willow table is laden with sweet snacks.

node.name: Beech Glade, Spring Chancel
node.description: A natural spring bubbles up over a carved stone spillway into a basin of polished rose quartz. Light collects around the water, radiating from within the quartz. A lattice of leaves shelters this area, making it quiet enough to commune with Kuniyo, or whichever deity speaks to the devoted's heart.

A natural spring bubbles up over a carved stone spillway into a basin of polished rose quartz. A soft light sparkles in the surfaces of the basin, and the water glints as it catches the reflection of the home fire inside the circle of beech trees. A lattice of leaves shelters this area from the dark beyond, making this spot quiet and peaceful enough to commune with Kuniyo, or whichever deity speaks to the devoted's heart.

node.name: The Beech Cordon, Inner Circle
node.description: Nearly hidden within the massive groves of towering ironwood and beech trees, a small log cabin stands like a silent sentinel. With its oval doorway carefully propped open by a hand-carved wooden statue, one wonders if this is a standing invitation to those who travel here.

node.name: Beech Glade, Trail
node.description: A narrow trail leads a short distance away from the cordon and ends at the entrance to a weathered hide tent.

node.name: Horse's Haven
node.description: A narrow pathway leads into an open area filled with the comings and goings of horses and their owners. Fresh bales of hay are stacked up against the wall of a well-made stable and the whinnies of horses come from its wide-open doors.

node.name: Beech Grove, Paddock
node.description: Surrounded by trees, a workout area has been set up for horses and their riders. A white-edged fence and a vine-covered wall are set up to practice jumping techniques, along with barrels to aid in mastering turns.

node.name: Horse's Haven, Training Field
node.description: Warning signs are painted on surrounding trees giving notice to spectators that jousters have the right of way. A quintain is set up in the middle of the field painted in the colors of forest green and brown.

node.name: Horse's Haven, Training Field
node.description: Freshly cleared, this area is laid out with a list for jousting. Hard packed dirt is covered with the stamp of hoofs and dead foliage.

node.name: Standish's, Tack and Gear
node.description: This small open-air room holds all that is needed for the care of horses or ponies. The scent of fresh oats permeates the air with a hint of apple from a nearby barrel. From baskets and trunks to boxes of feed this shop caters to the every need of horses and their owners.

node.name: Standish's, Barding
node.description: Sturdy oaken racks display a variety of plate, chain, and leather barding, each set carefully polished and shined or oiled to entice you to buy. A young girl sits in a corner embroidering a scarlet caparison, her feet tucked primly beneath her stool. Lining the walls are colorful pictures of proud steeds outfitted in full battle regalia.

Sturdy oaken racks display a variety of plate, chain, and leather barding, each set carefully polished and shined or oiled to entice you to buy. Lining the walls are colorful pictures of proud steeds outfitted in full battle regalia.

node.name: Beech Cordon, Bank Under the Roots
node.description: Damp dirt held in place by a network of butternut tree roots forms the walls of a rounded underground chamber, rich with the scents of cool sweet earth. A large rough-hewn thick plank serves as a counter, and a pale-haired Elothean teller with tiny mole-like eyes stares behind thin wired glasses in the dim light, waiting to do your bidding. The faint glow of a moongate in another chamber beyond dances within the shadows of a dimly lit earthen tunnel.

node.name: Beech Cordon, Foreign Exchange
node.description: A hole open to the the sky pierces the tangle of roots and earth overhead. Although underground, a faint moonbeam pushes through the opening in the ceiling and a glimmering moon gate stands wavering in the dimness. An ever vigilant moon mage, employed by the bank, hovers near the gate to ensure contact with other banks remains steady. A pair of unusual wolf-like creatures, black as twilight, and fierce as wolverines, watch every move you make.

node.name: Langenfirth, Trail Above the Fens
node.description: Almost buried in the fallen pine needles that cover the area between Gwenalion Fens to the east and Seord'telgi Teorn to the north, this narrow path wanders westward toward the distant hills. Small sounds of daily life -- children squealing at play, a dinner call, the cry of a baby -- are wafted by the wind and populate the forest with echoes.

Almost buried in the fallen pine needles that cover the area between Gwenalion Fens to the east and Seord'telgi Teorn to the north, this narrow path wanders westward towards the distant hills. Small sounds of a village at sleep -- a baby's hungry cry, a dog barking, a lone door slamming -- are wafted by the wind and populate the forest with echoes.

node.name: Kweld Andu, Warding Gate
node.description: A huge, plain stone gate blocks entry into the canyon to the south, while a great mound of dirt fills the skyline to the north.

node.name: Kweld Andu, Tumulus
node.description: A worn dirt pathway traces along the base of a large mound to the west and northeast. The mound's construction copies that of a mass burial pit, an obviously unnatural heap of soil placed quickly and unceremoniously to cover the dead.

node.name: Kweld Andu, Tumulus
node.description: The faint smell of a blood drifts in periodically from the north. A large gate stands to the south, barely visible around the base of the mound.

node.name: Kweld Andu, Tumulus
node.description: The scent of a fresh kill rides strong in the wind. Not entirely unwelcome, the smell proves that at least something lives in this depressing environ.

node.name: Kweld Andu, Tumulus
node.description: A dwarf sized hole has been dug into the side of the mound. An overwhelming smell of animal waste and rotten flesh emanates from the hole. A few speckles of blood and the indention of numerous paw prints hint that the lair may just be occupied.

node.name: Kweld Andu, Tumulus
node.description: The scent of a fresh kill floats through the air, tempting the curious to explore to the south. The trail bends to the northwest, pushing between some stone cliffs and the base of the mound.

node.name: Kweld Andu, Tumulus
node.description: Smooth, high stone cliffs seem to stretch to the sky as they stand watch over the great burial mound.
The light colored rock reflects the heat of the sun, making this area quite warm, even in winter.

node.name: Kweld Andu, Tumulus
node.description: Smooth, high stone cliffs seem to stretch to the sky as they stand watch over the great burial mound.
The light colored rock reflects the heat of the sun, making this area quite warm, even in winter.

node.name: Kweld Andu, Tumulus
node.description: A queer sense of absence mingles with the soil, as if a great loss has been dealt this desolate land.

node.name: Kweld Andu, Tumulus
node.description: Occasionally an old arrowhead, a rusted armguard, or a worthless sword pushes its way through the soil, giving evidence that this place was once used for something more than burial. A sense of intermingled fear and struggle radiate off the broken pieces of warfare, almost as a warning to those who happen to pass by.

node.name: Kweld Andu, Tumulus
node.description: A cloak of dread encompasses this place, pushing one to move on.

node.name: Kweld Andu, Tumulus
node.description: The huge burial mound releases the silent, cool feeling of death which flows through the soil and rises into the air like the gentle hand of a temptress before pulling her victims to damnation.

node.name: Kweld Andu, Tumulus
node.description: The worn pathway traces the base of the tumulus, but it appears to be an easy climb to the top of the great burial mound.

node.name: Kweld Andu, Atop Tumulus
node.description: Sitting above the path which circles the tumulus below, this place is an excellent location to witness the unbelievable workmanship of the stone gate to the south. The near perfect edges of both the gate and the gateway stand at least twenty-five feet into the air. It is a remarkable feat to have created such a close fitting structure, let alone how it's massive weight was placed upon huge hinges.

node.name: Kweld Andu, Atop Tumulus
node.description: Giving a perfect view of the entire tumulus, this perch does not invite a feeling of relief or excitement. Either the gods have forsaken this place, or this place has forsaken the gods, but whichever it is clear that the life of this land has been sucked away. There is hardly enough left for the scavengers to eke out a hardened existence.

node.name: Kweld Andu, Atop Tumulus
node.description: Though the mound below may be quiet and unmoving, the sense of treading upon numerous dead, all thrown together in an unceremonious mess, can give even the strongest and bravest of the lands a moment of uneasiness. A feeling, perhaps, that the dead may rise up, or worse yet, pull the living down.

node.name: Kweld Andu, Wolf Lair
node.description: A low, rounded ceiling gives little room for anything larger than the local carnivores to operate freely. A small hole leads out of this stench filled lair.

node.name: Kweld Andu, Wolf Lair
node.description: The hardened dirt is covered in a rippled pattern of claw marks, displaying the tunneling skill of the bloodthirsty inhabitants. A choking wall of stench pushes in from the tunnel to the northwest.

node.name: Kweld Andu, Wolf Lair
node.description: Challenging will and fortitude, a sickening stench rushes in from the northwest.

node.name: Kweld Andu, Wolf Lair
node.description: Half filling this enlarged room is a pile of revolting refuse. Flesh, blood, and feces mix in a rotting mass and the stench tests the intestinal fortitude of visitors.

node.name: Kweld Andu, Wolf Lair
node.description: An intersection of three tunnels accounts for the numerous paw prints and relative cleanliness of this room. Although a dangerous wolf might happen along, the opportunity to breathe fresh air is tempting.

node.name: Kweld Andu, Wolf Lair
node.description: About two feet of a large round stone peeks out from the floor, buried beneath the soil of this dark lair.

node.name: Kweld Andu, Wolf Lair
node.description: A shallow depression in the middle of this dead-end corridor is covered in coarse fur and cleaned bones.

node.name: Twisting Trail, Danduwen Forest
node.description: Drooping branches cross the trail, slowing progress through the thick woods. Though the forest rises up all around, the North Road is within sight when the wind catches the foliage at just the right angle.

node.name: Twisting Trail, Danduwen Forest
node.description: Branches along each side of the trail are broken, as if something large had passed this way. The trail continues to twist and turn, well out of sight of the North Road.

node.name: Gorbesh Fortress, Outside Gate
node.description: The terrain breaks slightly to reveal a wooden fort tied with netting to blend in with its surroundings. A guard tower camouflaged with branches rises above the fortress gate, providing an eagle-eye view of any who approach.

node.name: Gorbesh Fortress, Practice Yard
node.description: The ground in this open square is trampled flat, aside from one young deobar tree which stands in the middle of the yard. Ragged target dummies bearing crude parodies of the guild crests are tied in nooses from a branch.

node.name: Gorbesh Fortress, Stable
node.description: Facing out onto the practice yard, these few covered stalls once provided temporary shelter for the mounts of the officers. A few bits of straw are caught in the slats of a hayrack.

node.name: Gorbesh Fortress, Guard Tower
node.description: The tower walls are notched and charred, apparently damaged in a pitched battle. Deep gouges along the outside timbers of the guard tower tell the tale of a brutal assault -- one the archers who stood here could not withstand.

node.name: Gorbesh Fortress, Mess Hall
node.description: Low benches are pulled up to long wooden tables. Some sort of greenish crust stains the tables in spots.

node.name: Gorbesh Fortress, Firepit
node.description: Two iron rods ending in hooks are planted in the ground next to a sooty bowl-shaped depression. Judging from the trail of colorful splats and splotches on the ground leading west to the mess hall, this is where the Gorbesh prepared their food.

node.name: Gorbesh Fortress, Storage
node.description: Empty hooped barrels are wedged into the corners of the room, nailed to the walls with metal spikes. The ceiling is lined with dozens of hooks. A sign in an unknown language is carved into the wall.

node.name: Gorbesh Fortress, Meeting Room
node.description: High-backed chairs sit around a scarred table. Blobs of candlewax discolor the table and floor, telling the story of long hours spent in planning, lasting deep into the night.

node.name: Gorbesh Fortress, Officers' Quarters
node.description: Rank may have its privileges, but you wouldn't know it to look at this room. A half-dozen cots are lined up neatly, with one table and washbasin to serve all the inhabitants.

node.name: Gorbesh Fortress, Barracks
node.description: The bunks filling the barracks are huge, a testament to the sheer size of the Gorbesh warriors. There is room for little else here, and the occupants must have had to crawl over each other to reach the door.

node.name: Forest, Shaded Path
node.description: Tall trees clothed in resplendent foliage rise up to either side, standing like sentinels over the path. A carpet of soft grass covers the ground the trees so jealously guard, and the hoot of owls winds in and out through the branches, calling out a quiet watch.

Green trees grow to either side of the path, tall and clothed in resplendent foliage. Shimmering leaves of a pleasant hue create a gentle music as they shiver against one another. The path is carpeted in soft greenery, and the whistling of roosting birds fills the air and wafts on the breeze in time with the rustling leaves.

node.name: Forest, Shaded Path
node.description: The sweet scent of crushed grass rises in the air, an almost palpable cloud. Trees clothed in a myriad of greens march alongside the path, growing straight and tall as they reach for the vaulting skies above.

node.name: Forest, Shaded Path
node.description: The trees grow close together, creating an arching tunnel and enforcing a sense of being closed in. The path stretches in a line of green to the north and south, unrolling with slow, lazy ease.

node.name: Forest, Path's End
node.description: The trees round out the path, ending it with a thick stand of tender maple, spinebrush, and aspen. Bowing silently in homage to the small altar set up at the spot where the path terminates, the trees nod in a gentle breeze, reaffirming their faith to the entity that guards and protects them from harm.
The trees round out the path, bowing silently in homage to the small altar set up at the spot where the path terminates.

node.name: Langenfirth, A Simple Lean-To
node.description: Several flat pieces of wood lay precariously upon some makeshift sawhorses, creating shelves for the wares sold in this quickly constructed shop. Sawdust thrown on the ground makes for cushioned stepping and defines the area well. Several clerks stand about talking to each other, barely noticing any customers who enter.

node.name: Ranger Guild, Hall
node.description: This large rustic hall is lined with many wooden benches guarded by trophy heads mounted high on the walls among an exquisite collection of bows, crossbows, arrows and bolts. A raised platform against the far wall bears flickering torches and a large awards case that proudly displays honors achieved by guild members.

node.name: Langenfirth, The Langenfirth Tree
node.description: A rickety platform in the top of this huge, tall, ancient tree provides a good look-out point with a view which is unbroken for many miles. It has given the towns folk, as they peer in many directions, fair warning of anything coming their way from the distant hills and early sightings of the barge arriving from Riverhaven. The town below is hidden beneath the tops of shorter firs, but the view far out into Gwenalion Lake is clear for miles.

node.name: Tinker's End, Repair Shop
node.description: A surly, grouchy dwarf sits near a pile of broken armor and cooking utensils banging away at dents. Down on his luck he had, years ago, opened this shop to make a few coins. Since then he has re-edged, banged out dents, grumbled, and complained but never quite made enough money, or so he says, to get back to his mining. In a large bin are a number of odd things for sale, apparently items brought in for repair but never picked up.

node.name: Temple, Courtyard
node.description: A pleasant garden with several stone benches fills the area between the street and the temple. Wildflowers and berry bushes have been cultivated in narrow plots about the courtyard. The occasional chirp or song of a bird is all that breaks the silence.

node.name: Temple, Main Altar
node.description: The temple is the only stone building in Langenfirth, built so long ago that history fails to say when or by whom. It is believed, at least by the locals, that it was here long before the town. The strange design and construction give weight to those beliefs. The center of the room is taken up by a huge circular altar. Through a wide arch is a quiet courtyard garden. The stone of the walls appears roughly cut, but the blocks are extremely uniform.

node.name: Town Hall, Main Room
node.description: There is not much government in Langenfirth and that is reflected in the Town Hall. All that is ever handled here is the simple payment of taxes and debts. The hall has a homey feel to it, furnished to resemble someone's home. Several chairs sit near a fireplace, and there is a well worn rug on the floor. A ledger sits on a shelf covered with a thick layer of dust.

node.name: Town Hall, Office
node.description: The room is less office than personal living quarters. A desk and a cot fill part of the room, while ledgers and stacks of trading records fill up most of the empty floor space. Dust coats everything and motes fly about with every draft through the open door. It does not appear that even the Mayor uses this place very often. A clerk reads through various ledgers trying to determine who still owes debts and who has paid.

node.name: Langenfirth, Stock Pens
node.description: Several pigs, a goat and some sheep mill about a small wooden pen. While the towns tradesmen expect hard coin from travelers and traders, with the locals they will often barter stock for services or products. The floor of the pen is covered with wet, mucky straw and the pen smells of both fresh and well-aged manure. Over the years this small holding pen was built simply to keep the locals' currency from wandering about and bothering visitors.

node.name: Langenfirth, Caravan Reed Barn
node.description: This barn was made for wealthy travelers wishing to stable their animals while in Langenfirth. With its woven reed walls and raised slat flooring, animals are kept relatively warm and dry. Several stable lads make sure that the animals in their charge are well-fed and watered and that the stalls are mucked out regularly.

node.name: Langenfirth, Obscure Trail
node.description: The trail leading up to the door of a dilapidated cabin appears to have been made by small animals and not recently used. It is hard to follow it through the underbrush, and low tree limbs block any easy movement. The forest is almost silent except for the distant call of a bird and the wind rustling high in the tree top.

node.name: Cabin, Hideaway
node.description: While no one has taken any time to maintain the outside of the cabin, a great deal of decorating has been done inside. The rough log walls have been covered with embroidered hangings. A flagstone fireplace is in pristine condition, and several large logs crackle in the fire. A thick hide rug covers the floor and there is a pile of pillows laying near the fire.

node.name: Bowyer Shop, Jarrod's Quarters
node.description: The backroom serves as both home and workshop for Jarrod. A master tracker and hunter, he is used to living in the woods without amenities, and that shows in the sparse quarters. On a low table is a work in progress, either a special order or a newly designed bow.

node.name: Fairegrounds Entrance
node.description: A woven bracken arch festooned with ivy and flowering vines serves as the entrance to the fairegrounds. People are milling about the entrance hawking their wares while small children run to and fro playing games and singing. An air of frivolity and joy surrounds everyone present at the occasion.

node.name: Cabin, Front Room
node.description: A stone fireplace with a wood mantelpiece has a warm fire which casts a warm glow throughout the room. Shadows cast by the flickering flames dance on a nearby rocking chair and a long table along the wall. A bearskin rug lies across the hearth making the room appear very homey and comfortable. Log steps nailed to the wall provide a way to reach an upper loft area. The door is closed firmly but the window is unshuttered with a nice view of the street.

The main room of this cabin is furnished with a table and a rocking chair. A stone fireplace with a wood mantelpiece has a warm fire glowing in it. A bearskin rug lies across the hearth making the room very homey and comfortable. Log steps nailed to the wall provide a way to reach an upper loft area. The door is closed firmly but the window is unshuttered with a nice view of the street.

node.name: Cabin, Loft
node.description: Most of the loft is filled with a straw mattress covered in muslin. The peaked roof gives plenty of headroom in the center, but descends to the floor along the walls. This is a cozy sleeping area, separate from the living area downstairs, and warmed by the heat of the fireplace rising upward.

node.name: Small Cabin, Room
node.description: The warm glow of the lantern fills the room with a soft yellow light. The lantern sits on a small wooden table in the center of the tidy cabin. On one wall is a narrow bunk with a thin mattress, covered with a thin gray blanket. A small wooden door leads out to the street.

The bare logs of the walls have not even been stripped of bark. A narrow bunk, with a thin mattress and a ragged gray wool blanket, is attached to one wall across the room from the door. A wood table sits in the center of the small room with a lantern placed on it. While small and sparsely furnished, the room is very tidy.

node.name: Langenfirth, Up a Towering Deobar Tree
node.description: Nestled amongst the newer cabins of the small town, the deobar tree is a natural escape from the urbanization of Langenfirth. The sounds of soft rolling water drift from somewhere beyond the housing area.

node.name: Small Cabin
node.description: This tiny cabin offers a quick rest for the road weary in the form of a low cot which sits in a corner of the room.

node.name: Gwenalion Fens, In the Water
node.description: Cool water, stained dark with peat, laps around you as you swim. About shoulder-high on a Dwarf, it seems to maintain a fairly constant depth in this area, though the darker color beyond the hummocks indicates that the bottom drops off dramatically.

node.name: Gwenalion Fens, In the Water
node.description: Shadows visible from the corner of the eye seem to disappear when looked at directly, hidden by the dark waters of the lake. The water is deep, even close to shore. Fortunately there are plenty of hummocks nearby, so it should be a simple matter to scramble out of the lake.

node.name: Gwenalion Fens, In the Water
node.description: Long, silvery fish dart through the water, twisting and turning with sinuous grace before disappearing into a tangle of water weeds. Reed hummocks jostle against each other as they drift, but there is plenty of room to slip between.

node.name: Gwenalion Fens, In the Water
node.description: Golden petals float through the water, blown from a nearby hummock. The color is vivid against the dark water. For a moment, the usual miasma of rotting vegetation and dead fish is overcome by a subtle sweet fragrance to be enjoyed until the wind shifts direction.

node.name: Gwenalion Fens, In the Water
node.description: The occasional cry of a nesting gull drifts over the water, mocking you from the shore. Visibility is low in the water, clouded by dark brown strands of peat washed off the shore each time it rains. Still, the lake floor seems solid despite the silt.

node.name: Gwenalion Fens, In the Water
node.description: A chill current swirls around as thick rivulets of muddy water wash into the lake from the nearby fens. Tufts of fur, leaves and other castoffs from the land are all carried into the depths, quickly sinking out of sight.

node.name: Gwenalion Fens, In the Water
node.description: Something splashes to the east, hidden from view by a nearby hummock. The sounds of the fens carry a long way over water -- a roar, a cry of pain, a splash as something falls into the water -- making it impossible to tell with any certainty just where they originate.

node.name: Gwenalion Fens, In the Water
node.description: Deep brown strands of peat float in the dark water as it surges sullenly against the shoreline. Tangled mats of dried reeds and vines dot the surface, providing homes to otters, beavers and nesting birds. Wide enough to support several people, these hummocks drift aimlessly with the tides.

node.name: Gwenalion Fens, In the Water
node.description: Waterlogged clumps of dead reeds and branches, stripped of their bark and bleached white by the sun, toss amidst the darkling waves like dead men's bones given new life in the murky water. Some will drift together and be caught in the weeds to form one of the floating hummocks which dot the lake. Most will simply sink and join the uncharted obstacles beneath the surface.

node.name: Gwenalion Fens, In the Water
node.description: In grannys' tales told round the fire, the words Once upon a time are a familiar beginning. Once upon a time, legend might have it, a giant stepped into the muddy fens, his footprint forming the mighty Lake Gwenalion. The reality is doubtless more prosaic, involving long-gone sheets of ice or curious creatures trapped in stone. But for now, there is only dark water ruffled by a breeze that drives the floating hummocks before it.

node.name: Gwenalion Fens, In the Water
node.description: A strong current tugs at your legs, trying to pull you under the surface. The steady flow makes it hard to maintain balance in the water. Several tangled reed hummocks sway gracefully nearby, dancing in the current. The closest is within easy reach.

node.name: Gwenalion Fens, In the Water
node.description: Twisting passages of dark water wend their way amidst the fens, defined by the floating reed islets that bob restlessly in the waves. The shore is hidden from view -- only the desolate calls of hawks circling overhead mark its presence somewhere to the northwest.

node.name: Gwenalion Fens, In the Water
node.description: Rotting fish corpses emit a sickly sweet stench as they bob aimlessly in the water. Their graceful bodies once darted quickly beneath the surface. Now they are swept by the waves or caught in the hummocks' tangled reeds, their sightless eyes staring accusingly at the sky.

node.name: Gwenalion Fens, In the Water
node.description: Silvery reflections glimmer against the surface of the lake. A soft spray of foam surges into the air as the water dashes against the reed mats that surround you, coating your face. The crash of water drowns out the faint cries of birds, but cannot compete with the harsh, inarticulate roars from the nearby hummocks.

node.name: Gwenalion Fens, In the Water
node.description: An oddly warm current eddies around you. Warm in comparison to the rest of the lake, at least, but still cold enough to send shivers down your spine as you trudge through the murky depths of the water. Permeating the air with a sickly sweet stench, rotting vegetation washes off the shore and hummocks, sinking to the bottom only to swirl around in dark brown clouds when disturbed.

node.name: Gwenalion Fens, In the Water
node.description: Rising from the surface, wavering tendrils of mist reach up to curl about in eldritch patterns that make it difficult to see. Silence falls heavily upon the area, broken only by the relentless plop, plop, plop of water dripping from the nearby hummocks.

node.name: Gwenalion Fens, In the Water
node.description: The water darkens to a deep greenish-black to the east as the bottom slopes sharply down. No hummocks drift past the fen's protected waters, bobbing instead in the shallows to the north and west. To the east is merely open water as far as the eye can see.

node.name: Gwenalion Fens, In the Water
node.description: Swarms of gnats envelop anyone standing still along the southern end of the fens. Visibility beneath the surface is occluded by murky clouds of silt and mud that billow up with every step. The water is darker still near the edge of a drop-off to the east, while a dense tangle of reeds that will someday form one of the fens' floating hummocks blocks passage to the south.

node.name: Gwenalion Fens, In the Water
node.description: Frogs and crickets hidden on the nearby hummocks join in a joyful chorus that echoes all around the lake. The water is cold and footing uncertain in the dim light one minute solid, the next forcing the traveler to scramble for solid ground.

node.name: Gwenalion Fens, In the Water
node.description: Muddy water soaks through boots and shoes to leave even the hardiest adventurer shivering as he slogs past the relative dryness of the hummocks. While it would be easy to climb out, the traveler might thereby miss the somewhat dubious experience of the reeking stench of rotted fish and other less pleasant fragrances.

node.name: Gwenalion Fens, In the Water
node.description: Water and mud, mud and water... The fens' unchanging scenery is broken only by the slight variations in the reed hummocks that bob to and fro in the icy water. One may support a few tangled blossoms, another is home to a beaver or otter. But from here, most are out of reach, while the frigid water is all too present.

node.name: Gwenalion Fens, In the Water
node.description: Footing is uncertain at best as you skirt the edge of a drop-off to the east. The shallow shelf at the southwestern end of the lake defines the fens region. Winter storms sweep dried reeds into the area to tangle with water weeds and form the characteristic reed hummocks that drift aimlessly about the water for a season or two before returning to the rich soil from which they came.

node.name: Langenfirth, Up an Oak Tree
node.description: Crisp clean air flows through the treetop. From this height, one can easily spy the light stream of smoke billowing from a small cabin nestled among the trees to the north and the commercial hub of the outpost holding off the encroachment of the wilderness to the east.

node.name: Langenfirth, Up a Tall Pine Tree
node.description: Amongst the blue needles and pine cones of this large tree an offering of solitude for the occasional tree-sitter is provided. Off to the west the outlines of cabins pollute the horizon of this once wild land.

node.name: Calliana Leather Goods, Work Room
node.description: The workroom of the shop is awash with scraps. Bits and pieces of leftover hides are strewn about the tables and floor. On a long worktable are several leather items in various states of repair, and on a nearby rack are the beginnings of several new projects. Well cared for tools and sharp needles are arranged on a high shelf.

node.name: 'Neer's Hummock, Game Trail
node.description: Briar bushes encroach the small path, reaching to rip at passersby. At least one beast failed to escape the thorny grasp, as evidenced by the thick strands of wool, which hang lifelessly entrapped. The game trail branches here, the directions most worn from travel climbing sharply to the north and cutting along a side slope to the southeast.

node.name: 'Neer's Hummock, Side Hill
node.description: The trail cuts through the brush here at the base of the hill. Barely visible in the darkness, the trail curls around the hill, rising sharply to the east. The ground shifts under your feet as you move, making ascent difficult. To the northwest, the trail descends at an easier angle.

The trail winds its way through the brush and rises steeply up the face of the hill to the east. The trail does not appear to be heavily used, and the soil underfoot is loose, making ascent difficult. To the northwest, the trail descends at an easier angle.

node.name: 'Neer's Hummock, Side Hill
node.description: Grass is interspersed with small shrubs along this section of the hill. The brush thickens downhill, while the slope opens up to the east, betraying rough terrain and a difficult climb.

node.name: 'Neer's Hummock, Side Hill
node.description: The slope rises at a steep angle, the trail making the ascent only slightly less difficult as it winds its way across the uneven ground. The trail begins to disappear to the northeast, where the grass grows taller and the terrain becomes even rougher.

node.name: 'Neer's Hummock, Side Hill
node.description: The trail fades into the grass, giving way to the steep and uneven terrain. Loose stones and tufts of grass tumble down the slope as you try to maintain your footing. Small patches sprinkled all over the slope show signs of some recent grazing.

node.name: 'Neer's Hummock, Meadow
node.description: A few ferns have sprung up here, owing their life to damp soil. The water must percolate from below, for there is no evidence of a running spring.

node.name: 'Neer's Hummock, Meadow
node.description: The vegetation thrives here, apparently unaware of the presence of a steep cliff. Down the abrupt drop-off, loose rock and dirt promise an impossible climb and a deadly fall.

node.name: 'Neer's Hummock, Wolves' Refuge
node.description: Alone, in the ground covering grass, stands a tall, proud, yet oddly colored oak tree. Spreading wide its thick limbs, the tree offers shade and protection from the elements. Beneath the tree, the grass is broken, trampled, and torn. Bone, hide, and the distinct odor of blood mark this place as home to the wolves of 'Neer's Hummock.

node.name: 'Neer's Hummock, Meadow
node.description: A few rogue wildflowers dance among the grass, daring to claim their place. Leading through a break in the trees, an exposed path veers off towards a small glade.

node.name: 'Neer's Hummock, Meadow
node.description: Rising to the calf of a human, the grass of this plain, quiet meadow spreads forth in a sea of yellow-green. The temptation to lie and take rest is strong, but not advised when the local carnivorous beast happens along.

node.name: 'Neer's Hummock, Meadow
node.description: The view from atop this hill is quite limited due to the trees, which surround this lush meadow.

node.name: 'Neer's Hummock, Game Trail
node.description: The game trail is wide, level, and holds a few shrubs atop this hummock. Intermittent, frightening howls can be heard, swirling among the trees.
The game trail is wide, level, and holds few trees atop this hummock. Sounds of the wild are unnervingly absent here, save the occasional rambling beast.

node.name: 'Neer's Hummock, Game Trail
node.description: Pressed into the soft dirt alongside this steep trail are an animal's tracks. It doesn't take a ranger to discern that these large, deep paw prints are the work of a predator. Although the trail descends steeply to the south, a change in grade can be seen towards the east, over the next rise.

node.name: 'Neer's Hummock, Game Trail
node.description: The steep grade of the trail doesn't seem to bother the wildlife that use it daily, but for adventurers used to flatter lands, it is a sweaty climb. The path continues its relentless rise to the north.

node.name: 'Neer's Hummock, Meadow
node.description: Faint, barely surviving upon the wind, is the scent of blood. The smell seems to arrive from the east, hinting at a fresh kill. Grass covered ground continues to descend slightly to the south.

node.name: 'Neer's Hummock, Clearing
node.description: Sparse trees and shrubs mingle with short, fragile grass beneath the open sky. Small, criss-crossing paths cut through the grass, revealing the heavy use creatures give this place.

node.name: 'Neer's Hummock, White Birch Tree Limb
node.description: The narrow branch trembles with the weight of visitors seeking a peaceful spot to rest in the tree. White bark covering the trunk peels easily and is marked by narrow horizontal stripes, which camouflage the marks left by travelers on their climb.

node.name: 'Neer's Hummock, Green Ash Tree Limb
node.description: Long green leaves surrounding the branch each have several pairs of leaflets, which are darker at the base and grow paler near the tips. The bark on the tree's trunk is brown to dark grey and covered in interlacing furrows that add traction for visitors needing to climb down from here.

node.name: 'Neer's Hummock, Red Birch Tree Limb
node.description: The narrow branch trembles with the weight of visitors seeking a peaceful spot to rest in the tree. Salmon-colored bark covering the trunk peels and turns to dark red-brown plates as it ages, making the climb back down a challenge.

node.name: 'Neer's Hummock, Blue Ash Tree Limb
node.description: Fern-like fronds covered in long, pointed leaves drape down from the surrounding branches, resembling graceful fans awaiting the next passing breeze. Tiny ridges cover the bluish tinged bark, adding a little traction for visitors needing to climb down from here.

node.name: 'Neer's Hummock, Elm Tree Limb
node.description: Leaves drooping off branches overhead blanket each side of the limb in foliage, muffling any sounds from the meadow. The smooth bark of the tree's trunk is marred with scars and slashes left from visitors clumsily climbing down to resume their travels.

node.name: 'Neer's Hummock, Oak Tree Limb
node.description: Chunks of bark missing along the branch look as if something or someone has pulled it off to expose the raw wood. Scarring the tree's trunk, stumps left from broken limbs form makeshift footholds for anyone needing to climb down from here.

node.name: 'Neer's Hummock, Oak Tree Limb
node.description: From this branch, one can easily see across the meadow while safely observing the beasts prowling below. Scarring the tree's trunk, stumps left from broken limbs form makeshift footholds for anyone needing to climb down from here.

node.name: 'Neer's Hummock, Elm Tree Limb
node.description: From this height, visitors can easily see across the meadow to a path that leads through a break in the surrounding wall of trees. Scratches on the smooth bark of the trunk show that more than travelers have used it to climb on.

node.name: Wolf Oak, Lower Branches
node.description: The multi-layered, thickly leafed branches of the oak allow very little light to penetrate to this section of the tree. It is dark, yet not quite pitch black as an occasional vagrant beam sneaks past a branch swayed by a passing breeze. A large twisted limb branches out from the tree to the northeast while two smaller limbs extend to the north and to the southeast.

Sunlight filters past the thickly leafed, multi-layered branches of the oak in dancing motes that play upon the dark trunk of the tree like fireflies flitting through a midnight sky. A large twisted limb branches out from the tree to the northeast while two smaller limbs extend to the north and to the southeast.

node.name: Wolf Oak, Smooth Limb
node.description: Much of the outer bark of this limb has been stripped away, leaving exposed the smooth inner wood of the tree. Though the limb extends far out to the north it would be dangerous to proceed further in that direction.

node.name: Wolf Oak, Scarred Limb
node.description: Lightning from a long forgotten storm has left a legacy of scars along the length of this tree limb. The limb thins quickly as it extends to the southeast, making it impossible to proceed any further in that direction. It is, however, possible to go back down to the main trunk of the tree.

node.name: Wolf Oak, Twisted Limb
node.description: The growth of this limb has been twisted by the weight of several branches pressing against it. It manages, however, to provide a stable perch for climbers despite its oddly configured dips and curves. Moving further along the limb to the southwest would be practical only for birds and squirrels, but one might travel down the limb to the main trunk of the tree with ease.

node.name: Fang Cove, Fate's Fortune Lane
node.description: A towering marble archway opens a gap in the wall to the north and separates the ongoing construction and somewhat more refined completed structures of Fate's Fortune Lane from the crude structures and makeshift walkway along the beach. The entrance to a squat, wide bungalow sits in opposition to the arch, and the sheltering cliffs of Fang's Peak rise up from behind it. To either side of the arch, cobblestones of different shapes and sizes have been laid out to form the wide Fate's Fortune Lane.

node.name: Ker'Leor, Deep Forest Path
node.description: An endless assortment of towering trees and vividly-colored underbrush crowd the base of Ker'Leor. So dense is the forest that steam rises from its floor, hanging as a still mist which threatens to obscure the faint path. Eerie wails, moans and hisses echo forth from the deep shadows, bending the imagination toward the hideous and threatening.

node.name: Theren's Star, Deck
node.description: The first of the massive barges to traverse Lake Gwenalion, Theren's Star still maintains a quiet elegance despite its apparent age. The utilitarian deck upon which casual travelers walk is spartan, but the decking is made of expensive tabor wood felled from far southern forests. An oval doorway leads down to the barge's cargo bay, while an elaborately-carved wooden door provides ingress to the comfortably appointed lounge.

node.name: Langenfirth Woods, Across the Brook
node.description: Gurgling sounds come from the water flowing past the embankment as it wends its way through the trees towards the distant lake. The constant humidity fosters the growth of luxuriant moss on the trunks, giving them a fuzzy appearance much like that of an animal's pelt.

node.name: Langenfirth Woods, Brookside
node.description: Trees thin as the forest approaches a stream flowing within steep embankments. The sounds of rushing water fill the area, a deep musical splash and bubble sound underlaid with a deep occasional rumble. The noise of the brook covers all other sounds of the woods, obscuring the passage of both humanoids and beasts.

node.name: Langenfirth Woods, Dense Woods
node.description: Clusters of trees clump together, as if each parent tree is surrounded by a horde of offspring that are seeking to protect their elder from harm. Between the clusters of trunks, the ground is covered with low shrubs and other underbrush. The rustle of leaves and twigs testify to the passage of numerous small animals as they scurry in search of food.

node.name: Langenfirth Woods, Forest Floor
node.description: Colossal trunks rise from the leaf-covered ground, rising seemingly effortlessly to the distant sky with outstretched limbs and branches. Little of the sky is visible, most of it blocked by the thick foliage above. Dangling from the distant branches are wispy strands of moss that help obscure the vault of the heavens.

node.name: Langenfirth Woods, Glade
node.description: Something long ago brought down one of the forest giants, allowing a break in the canopy. The rotting remains of the fallen titan lie on the forest floor, half-covered in rotting leaves and burgeoning vegetation. The distant sounds of nightbirds ring through the open space, welcome in the silence of the forest.

node.name: Langenfirth Woods, Thicket
node.description: Trunks of towering trees close in near the game trail, blocking most light and making the route twist and bend in order to make any progress. The air hangs heavy and humid, helping the growth of the underbrush pack what little space remains beneath the canopy.

node.name: Langenfirth, The Carousel
node.description: In stark contrast to its humble exterior, the cabin opens out into a spacious waiting area. Exquisitely polished oak lines the walls. Wooden shutters stand open, allowing the breeze to carry the woody fragrance of the forest into the room. A flagstoned chimney lights the surroundings with a gentle blaze, just enough to discourage a chill. Along the far wall stands an oak registration desk.

node.name: Langenfirth, Rundmolen Post Office
node.description: Tucked into a corner of the cabin is a low stone counter. Vast, countless rows of differently sized shelves are behind the counter, and complex Dwarven mechanisms can be heard as they rearrange the package-covered storage. Clerks shuffle endlessly back and forth between the counters and shelving as they assist patrons with their packaging and mailing needs.

node.name: Beech Glade, Low Hammock
node.description: Just above the ground, the hammock sways gently with each movement. The quiet spot is pleasantly shaded.

node.name: Beech Glade, Forest Green Hammock
node.description: The branches hang low to almost completely conceal this spot, nestled among the restful rustling of the trees.

node.name: Beech Glade, White Hammock
node.description: The hammock is strung high in the trees, and sways gently in the breeze. Suspended between earth and sky, rest is easy to find.

node.name: Beech Glade, Snusk's Tent
node.description: A narrow corridor stretches off from the lobby area, along a row of tiny heat-warped stalls. The echoing clang of metal on metal rings out from behind the curtained openings like peals of tiny thunder.

node.name: Horse's Haven, Stables
node.description: Freshly cut wooden beams hold up a roof made of braided vines and thick ironwood branches. Each stall is spaciously built with plenty of room for grooming and feeding of the spectacular horseflesh that makes its home here.

node.name: Horse's Haven, Trading and Training
node.description: A grassy track leads to and from this training area, which also houses the trader's brokering office. Horses are led about by young and old alike as their teacher sternly instructs them on the proper care of their charges.

node.name: Stablemaster's Office
node.description: Charts, shelves of books and pictures cover the walls of this office, all featuring horses as their main theme. A small desk holds papers belonging to the Stablemaster whose job it is to make sure riders treat their horses with care. A couple of plain chairs offer a place to sit while waiting for her instructions.

node.name: Horse Brokerage, Office
node.description: The walls of this room rise chest-height on a human, allowing a gentle breeze to blow under the vine and branch braided roof. Benches surround a huge table carved from a single block of ironwood that dominates the otherwise sparse area. Designs of wild horses prance across the surface of the table, as scattered parchments block their way.

node.name: Shadethorn Forest, Faint Trail
node.description: A faint trail winds its way up the hillside, barely discernible through the dense undergrowth of shrubs and low grasses. Weathered roots from nearby trees cross the path, creating uneven steps. Scattered tufts of wildflowers cling to the slope, their petals trembling with every breeze. Small stones displaced by passing feet dot the trail, rolling toward the forest's shadowy edge.
A faint trail winds up the hillside, tangled with roots and dotted with loose stones. Wildflowers cling to the slope, their petals trembling as the path nears the forest's edge.

node.name: Shadethorn Forest, Faint Trail
node.description: The trail opens into a wide clearing surrounded by towering oaks and slender birches. Clusters of ferns line the edges, their delicate fronds brushing against moss-covered stones. The ground here is packed dirt, interrupted by patches of hardy grass. Scattered animal tracks mark the earth, while a hollowed log lies to one side, its interior home to small claw marks and broken twigs.
The trail widens into a clearing framed by oaks and birches. Ferns brush mossy stones, and animal tracks crisscross the packed dirt. A hollow log rests nearby, marked by small claws.

node.name: Shadethorn Forest, Sylvan Arch
node.description: At the heart of the forest, slender saplings intertwine to form a graceful living arch. Their braided trunks rise in perfect harmony, bark patterns blending where they meet. Fresh green shoots sprout from the weave, forming delicate fronds that dangle like ornaments. The ground beneath is clear of debris, marked only by soft mosses that thrive in the embrace of the arch's shelter.
At the forest's heart, saplings intertwine into a living arch, their braided trunks adorned with fresh shoots. Beneath, soft moss carpets the ground in the arch's shelter.

node.name: Shadethorn Forest, Northern Slope
node.description: The forest climbs a gentle slope, where large boulders protrude from the soil like ancient sentinels. Their surfaces are mottled with patches of pale lichen and streaked with weathered cracks. Between the stones, small saplings push upward, their leaves trembling in a faint breeze. Evidence of burrowing animals shows in the loose dirt around the roots.
The forest ascends a gentle slope, dotted with boulders streaked with cracks and lichen. Saplings grow between them, their leaves stirring faintly, while loose dirt reveals burrowed dens.

node.name: Shadethorn Forest, Silver Grove
node.description: At the base of the mountainside, a grove of silver-barked trees stands in quiet contrast to the rugged stone backdrop. The trunks curve gracefully upward, their branches tangled with wispy vines. A faint trail skirts the rocky incline, marked by scattered flakes of stone from above. The low sound of rustling leaves accompanies the occasional movements of unseen woodland creatures.
A grove of silver-barked trees rises against the rocky mountainside, their branches tangled in vines. A faint trail winds past scattered stone flakes amid rustling leaves and bird calls.

node.name: Shadethorn Forest, Beside a Stream
node.description: A shallow stream cuts through the forest, its pebbled banks lined with water-smoothed stones. Narrow reeds and patches of cattails grow in the calmer pools. Fallen leaves float lazily downstream, brushing against the occasional piece of driftwood lodged in the current. Small pawprints in the muddy bank suggest a recent visit from thirsty creatures.
A shallow stream winds through the forest, its banks dotted with reeds and cattails. Leaves drift along the current, brushing against driftwood, while pawprints mark the muddy shore.

node.name: Shadethorn Forest, Brambles
node.description: A narrow path snakes through dense thickets of brambles, their thorn-laden vines twisting in a chaotic weave. The air is faintly sweet with the scent of crushed berries underfoot. Stripped bark on the lower trunks of nearby trees hints at the passage of foraging animals. In places, the trail is barely visible, partially obscured by clusters of creeping ivy.
A narrow path winds through brambles, the thorny vines twisting in chaos. Crushed berries scent the air, while stripped bark and ivy hint at passing wildlife.

node.name: Langenfirth Crafting Society Outpost, Main Room
node.description: Broad wooden planks span the floor, contrasting warmly with three plain white walls, while the fourth is painted with a detailed mural of a sunlit forest. The ceiling is vaulted, with a combination of gaethzen owls and lanterns hung at regular intervals. An open floor plan invites patrons to explore other areas of the shop.

node.name: Langenfirth Crafting Society Outpost, Engineering Enclave
node.description: Broad floorboards stretch beneath a vaulted ceiling lined with suspended lanterns and elegant gaethzen owls. Archways connect this area to the rest of the shop, the curved woodwork inlaid with smooth stone rods. One wall is fashioned of a colorful herringbone pattern of colorful wood scraps, each protected with a shiny gloss.

node.name: Langenfirth Crafting Society Outpost, Enchanting Emporium
node.description: Vaulted overhead beams hold a series of alternating lanterns and sleek gaethzen owls. Beneath them, broad planks span the floor in uniform rows. One wall features an arrangement of gleaming metal artwork, each piece inscribed with a flowing medley of esoteric symbols.

node.name: Langenfirth Crafting Society Outpost, Alchemy Annex
node.description: Smooth wooden planks run wall to wall beneath a high vaulted ceiling, with lanterns and gaethzen owls hanging overhead. Three walls are plain white, while the fourth is painted with a kaleidoscope of flowering herbs. Cased openings engraved with wandering vines connect the space to the rest of the shop.

node.name: Langenfirth Crafting Society Outpost, Outfitting Outlet
node.description: The floor is laid with wide boards of pale wood, their grain worn smooth. One wall boasts a large tapestry depicting a collection of sewing tools and accessories. A vaulted ceiling supports hanging lights and gaethzen owls. Several archways lead to adjacent rooms, their glossy trim painted with bright white lines to mimic a tidy hem.
